Gujarat is a dazzlingly diverse state that shakes up the know-it-all Indophile, and reveals treasures hidden from the tourist hordes. Gujaratis are famous for their cheapness and entrepreneurship, both
n anywhere, from Wall Street to Wellington, and there’s a good chance they hail from this wealthy, resourceful state. There are many significant sites of God Krishna’s life lie along the coast of
.The geographic diversity and strategic location has made Gujarat home to an incredible diversity of people. With 20% of the country's total industrial output, it is the most industrialized state in

About 89% of the population of Gujarat are Hindu. Muslims account for 9% and Jain 1% of the population. Most of the Gujarati people are strict “vegetarians”. Amongst Hindus the deity of Krishna is famously worshipped in His form of Shrinathji throughout Gujarat. Since Gujarat being a heavily industrialized state of
, attracts lots of outsiders from various parts of

.
the people of Gujarat are the most lively folk you are likely to encounter in India,brimming with businessmen and all those exotic mouth watering delicacies,Gujarat is advertised by Bollywood superstar amitabh bachchan .whats more,Gujarat has many festivals like the rann mohotsav which is a versatile ,exorbitant and colorful festival where lakhs of people gather every year.originally started as a camel market.it now houses many different markets and mediums of entertainment.
the next place which you would like to visit is nalsarovar .thousands of migratory birds mainly flamingos flock in to survive the cold weather in their native countries.
Gujarat has the highest amount of state turnout being a business hub.the city of Ahmadabad and vadodara are two mini metros which are home to everything a modern tourist would like. from 5 star hotels to malls and multiplexes and also rich culture and heritage.
are mild, pleasant, and dry with average daytime temperatures around 80 °F(24 °C) and nights around 51 °F(10 °C) with 100 percent sunny days and clear nights.

are extremely hot and dry with day temperatures around 115 °F(46 °C) and at night no lower than 90 °F(34 °C) with sunshine. 
The time just before

, the temperature are similar to Summer but now there is high humidity which makes the air feel hotter. Relief comes when the monsoon season starts around in mid June. The day temperatures are lower to around 100 °F(38 °C) but humidity is very high and nights are around 80 °F(27 °C).

The Museum covers a wide variety of topics from Buddhism, Jainism and its darshans, grammar, tantra and poetics to Vedas, agama to the different branches of
n philosophy. It is learnt that this museum has the largest collection of Jain scripts which come around 75, 000 manuscripts with 500 illustrated versions and 45,000 printed books.

content=The three day Modhera Dance Festival is held every year during the third week end of January after the conclusion of Uttarayan festival. The dance festival is frequently visited by art and dance connoisseurs from all across the world. Classical and folk dancers and musicians from different states of the
exhibit their talent and flair while culture enthusiasts become part of the festival to witness this splendid event.
content=The three-four days International Kite Festival is held every year during the second/third week end of January at
during Uttarayan festival (14-January). Visitors come from around

for the celebration and international visitors have come from countless countries, including Japan, Italy, the UK, Canada, Brazil, Indonesia, Australia, the USA, Malaysia, Singapore, France, China, and many more.
content=The three day Rann Utsav is held every year during the Full moon night in the month of December at
and goes around the district with a grand finale. The festival is visited and enjoyed by more than 8000 tourists from all over the world to celebrate the mystical magic of

- The one-day Uttarayan is held every year 14th January at each and every cities and villages of Gujarat.Members of various communities irrespective of cast and creed are engaged in the business of kites. Rich or poor, people enjoy this festival in their own ways. The aerodynamic skill, devotion and ingenuity that goes into the kite making and flying is almost a religion in itself, honed to the level of an art form, though it looks deceptively simple.

-Bhadra Purnima is one of the biggest festivals of Gujarat, popularly known as the Ambaji Bhadra Purnima. This is because the festival is celebrated at Ambaji, a village which derives its name from the shrine located here. The village is situated at the foothills of Mount Aravalli.
-Modhera dance festival is one of the major festivals organized in the state of Gujarat. It is primarily a dance festival and showcases the various traditional dance forms of the region.

-Kutch Mahotsav serves as the guided tour of the Kutch region of Gujarat. It is organized by the Tourism Corporation of Gujarat and lasts for six day. This tour takes you around the venerated places in Kutch.

-Rath Yatra is a huge festival celebrated in Gujarat. Rath means chariot and Yatra means journey. As the name suggests, during the festival, huge wooden floats are prepared and the idols of Lord Krishna, Lord Balaram and Goddess Subhadra are placed in them.

-Dangs Darbar is an annual festival celebrated in the Dangs district, located in the Saputara Hills of India. The district is inhabited by the tribal people, who have lived in the region's woods and highlands since times memorial. This makes Dangs Darbar, essentially a tribal festival of Gujarat.

The Royal Orient train is one of the world's most exotic trains. The journey by the Royal orient train is a rare delight. It is an experience that takes you back to the times of Rajas and Maharajas. You get to explore two of the most fascinating and culturally rich states of
, Gujarat and Rajasthan. The train travel 7 days through

Gujarat is heaven for vegetarian (lacto-vegetarian) people. Approximately 80% of Gujaratis eat vegetarian foods only, and Gujarati vegetarian cuisine is very famous for its variety and quality. There are hundreds of lacto-vegetarian foods varieties are offered across Gujarat. Rotli (Chapati/Puri) , Shaak (Subzi/Vegetables/Curries), Mithai (Sweets), Rice and Dal are parts of a
in restaurants. In fact, it might be a little difficult to find non-vegetarian restaurants in Gujarat. International travelers can find multi-cuisine restaurants serving global varieties.

. Foreign tourists are partly exempted from this restriction and can drink in few Five Star Hotels like Taj and Courtyard by Marriott. Drinking in public is strictly prohibited. However, if you are going to stay longer in Gujarat, you may apply for an alcohol permit. Ask how to do it in your hotel or the place where you stay.
Gujarat is a relatively safe state.
